page.title: 14Local News.
page.content: On the road between Springhill Prison and Grendon Underwood Mrs.Mitchell and her daughter Clare were walking to school and when they got near to the brook a blue van swerved and knocked Mrs. Mitchell and Clare off the path and into the field.The blue van hit Mrs.Mitchell in the lungs and they shattered and that was the cause of her death.Clare was quite lucky as she was thrown clear of the metal bars and she lay in the field unconcious and it was later said that she had broken her leg and fractured her little finger. Mr. Mitchell was informed by Mr. Barrs that there had been an accident so he went straight to Stoke Mandeville Hospital. On the seventeenth of July Clare had her plaster taken off,but she had to have a knee bandage to support her leg.
